book.title: Ulysses
book.author: James Joyce
book.description: Ulysses chronicles the peripatetic appointments and encounters of Leopold Bloom in Dublin in the course of an ordinary day, 16 June 1904.

book.title: Maidenhair
book.author: Mikhail Pavlovich Shishkin
book.description: Maidenhair is composed of three main storylines: an interpreter listening to the stories of refugees, the letters he sends to his son, and the diaries of a Russian opera singer in the early 1900s. An instant classic of Russian literature, it was a finalist for the Best Translated Book Award.

book.title: The Unbearable Lightness of Being
book.author: Milan Kundera
book.description: 1984 novel about two women, two men, a dog and their lives in the Prague Spring period of Czechoslovak history in 1968.
